content.text:
[@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) 

>  what is the absolutley smallest we can get an hour long recording whilst still making it listenable?

Define "listenable". :wink: 

Have you heard samples of [Opus](http://opus-codec.org/) or [Codec2](http://www.rowetel.com/?page_id=452)? I originally heard about Codec2 in [this blog post](https://auphonic.com/blog/2018/06/01/codec2-podcast-on-floppy-disk/#codec2-examples) and the audio samples blew me away. An hour of audio weighing in at just over 1 MB. Modern vocoders are incredibly impressive.
